GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles with total comments, can filter by topic and sort and order by article properties - pagination is possible with limit and offset (p)

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an article selected by id with comment count

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: fetches comments linked to a given article id with pagination, limit and offset (p)

exampleResponse.body: The beautiful thing about treasure is that it exists. Got to find out what kind of sheets these are; not cotton, not rayon, silky.
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comment.description: posts a new comment to an article when provided username and body - username and article id must be valid

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates article votes when supplied with {int_votes: newVote} where newVote is a positive or negative integer

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes a comment with given comment id from comments database

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: update the votes on a comment given the comment's comment_id

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users

GET /api/users/:username.description: returns a single user matching the specified username

POST /api/articles.description: posts an article against a valid (existent) username and topic when provided with author, title, body, topic and optionally article_image_url

POST /api/topics.description: posts a new topic to topics table when provided slug and description
